title: ‘I’m Here! Can You Hear Me?’: One Family’s Story of Death in Gaza
description: The Abu Teirs thought the Israel-Hamas cease-fire might mean they could start to rebuild their lives. But a new round of Israeli airstrikes dashed those dreams.

title: Myanmar Military Fires on Chinese Red Cross Convoy in Quake Zone
description: It remains unclear whether the cease-fire would be honored. It comes a day after soldiers fired at a Chinese Red Cross aid convoy, and amid multiple airstrikes.
author: Sui-Lee Wee
categories: International Committee of the Red Cross

title: Gold Prices In US Hit New High After Trump's Bombshell Tariff Announcement
description: Stocks slumped, bonds surged, and gold hit a new high as markets braced for the impact of US President Donald Trump's sweeping reciprocal tariffs on Thursday.

title: Inside Trump's Reciprocal Tariffs: Which Countries Are Hit Hardest
description: After weeks of anticipation, US President Donald Trump unveiled sweeping new tariffs on trading partners Wednesday, calling it a "declaration of economic independence."

title: Donald Trump signs off UK’s handover of Chagos Islands to Mauritius
description: No 10 says deal to cede UK’s last African colony now being finalised after months of doubtDonald Trump has signed off the UK’s handover of the Chagos Islands to Mauritius, Downing Street has indicated, paving the way for the UK to cede sovereignty over its last African colony after a six-month standoff.Under the terms of the deal, the UK will give up control of the Chagos archipelago while paying to maintain control of a joint US-UK military base on the largest island, Diego Garcia, under a 99-year lease. Continue reading...
author: Eleni Courea Political correspondent

title: People displaced by Uganda oil pipeline ‘received inadequate compensation’
description: Many of the people displaced by Eacop project were inadequately rehoused or compensated, report saysPeople displaced from their homes alongside the site of an oil pipeline under construction in Uganda have complained of being inadequately rehoused or compensated.When completed, the East African crude oil pipeline (Eacop) will transport oil from the Tilenga and Kingfisher oilfields in western Uganda to the port of Tanga in Tanzania. Continue reading...
author: Carlos Mureithi in Nairobi

title: Putin sends powerful economic envoy to court Trump administration
description: Kirill Dmitriev, who runs Russia’s sovereign wealth fund, is expected to meet with Steve Witkoff, a key figure in efforts to secure an end to the war in Ukraine.
author: Catherine Belton

title: Saudi Arabia emerges as key hub for Trump’s foreign policy ambitions
description: Saudi Arabia’s mediation of high-stakes negotiations promises to revive a relationship the president and crown prince cultivated during Trump’s first term.
author: Susannah George

title: Trump imposes 10% tariff on nearly all countries, calls it 'economic independence'
description: President Trump declared a national emergency to implement new tariffs, aiming to protect the American economy and boost domestic production. The new framework raises baseline duties on nearly all imports, with more significant tariffs on key allies. This policy is expected to revert the U.S. to an era of high tariff-based revenue.
author: TOI World Desk

title: In Nepal's classrooms, youngsters wonder if republic has delivered
description: The 2001 Nepalese royal massacre resulted in the monarchy's end and a republic with frequent leadership changes. Rising disillusionment among the youth has led to a resurgence of pro-monarchy sentiments, driven by political instability and a lack of direction. Many students are calling for reliable governance.
author: Vishant Agarwala
